entry.title: won't you be my prophecy?
entry.summary:
Author: lauriesamy

Rating: General AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 10,542Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 12

Summary: Thinking of strong arms embracing him from behind. Amber eyes and a soft strand of hair falling over a forehead. A scar on the bottom lip and a tattoo wrapped around a forearm‚ÄîBuck blows on the eyelash. It flies away in the wind. Finally, he tears his eyes away from it. His stare meets Eddie‚Äôs again, whose grin still hasn‚Äôt diminished. Buck stutters out, ‚ÄúSorry,‚Äù and takes a small step away from him. Eddie still doesn‚Äôt budge. ‚ÄúNo, it's‚Äî‚Äù Eddie‚Äôs fingers brush over where Buck‚Äôs once were on his face. ‚ÄúUh, what does it mean?‚Äù ‚ÄúHmm?‚Äù ‚ÄúThe eyelash. It must mean something,‚Äù Eddie says. ‚ÄúApparently, everything has a hidden meaning now. Tell me about it.‚Äù His tone is soft, and Buck melts like putty in his hands.OR Buck becomes strangely and obsessively superstitious about all aspects of life to hide from the fact that he‚Äôs deeply in love with his straight best friend.

entry.title: And If I Drown, What Then?
entry.summary:
Author: Allypop_84

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 4,399Chapters: 2/12Kudos: 60

Summary: Post-lawsuit, Buck fights to reclaim his place at the 118. But the team he came back for doesn‚Äôt quite feel like home anymore, and the distance between him and Eddie keeps widening. Buck feels himself slowly disappearing - first from the team, then from himself. He's always been good at saving other people. He's never been good at saving himself. Or A Buck and Eddie post-lawsuit fic. ----------- Please heed the tags! This fic explores alcohol and substance abuse and may be triggering for some readers. If these themes are difficult for you, please put yourself first.

entry.title: Two Conditions
entry.summary:
Author: Buddiesmutslut

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 63,005Chapters: 11/12Kudos: 252

Summary: "A now-familiar rage boils up in Eddie's chest, and he shakes out his limbs, baring his teeth in relief when they call his name again. He'd been slated for three fights tonight, and this is his last one. Sweat is rolling down his back, and his body is probably going to ache in the morning, but he can't feel any of it yet because of the adrenaline. Not only as he already fought twice tonight, he'd also won both matches, and he doesn't feel like stopping. His limbs are still loose, there's energy still sparking through his veins, and the fury that he's been trying to expel all night is still firmly settled behind his breastbone, tendrils winding up his throat as if to choke him. He almost feels bad for whoever he's about to climb into the ring with." Or, one night sets Eddie on a whole new path.

entry.title: meet me where i left you
entry.summary:
Author: madforyou

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 28,360Chapters: 1/2Kudos: 53

Summary: Captain Buckley, who is steady, who has his shit together, who definitely does not recognize his new probie because he spent a night eight years ago with his hands in that man's hair whispering things against his skin that would get him fired on the spot if anyone in this building ever found out. "You must be Eddie Diaz." His hand goes out. Not shaking, by some miracle that deserves its own cathedral, its own patron saint, the patron saint of men who are dying inside and shaking hands about it. "Welcome to the 118. It‚Äôs nice to meet you, I‚Äôm Captain Buckley." Eddie takes his hand. A firm grip, calloused in places Buck doesn't remember, but Buck's skin recognizes him anyway, every nerve, all at once. "Captain." Eddie's voice is level, pleasant, perfectly neutral, and Buck would buy it completely if he couldn't see the tension bolted into Eddie's shoulders. "Thanks for having me." A beat. "You got a first name, Captain Buckley?" "Evan. But most people just call me Buck." "Buck," Eddie repeats, tasting it, dragging it out, and Buck's stomach drops through the floor. "Suits you." Or,Captain Buckley WILL NOT fuck his new probie, okay? At least, not again.

entry.title: By a Thread
entry.summary:
Author: walkslowlyandbowoften

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 7,240Chapters: 5/5Kudos: 68

Summary: Whenever Eddie pictured Buck in his mind‚Äôs eye, it was a snapshot of a time they‚Äôd gone to the beach all together, sometime before the tsunami had ruined that for everyone. Eddie was in the passenger seat of Buck‚Äôs jeep. Chris was in the back. Buck was driving, and the sunlight was setting his curls on fire, and he was laughing at something Chris had said. He was in an LAFD tank top that Eddie hadn‚Äôt seen since that day. Eddie‚Äôs phone had been tucked away in the beach bag, or else he would have snapped a picture to hang next to the others on his fridge. Buck, looking so much like himself in those days, before the added weight of everything that had happened since. ---- Buck and Eddie are just beginning to get back into the rhythm of their lives when a call goes disastrously wrong. While Buck's life hangs in the balance, both of them do some reflecting. Set sometime after Season 8, but for the purposes of this fic I'm not following Season 9 very closely.
